reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in a large office park, this is an ideal overnight location for a quick trip down the Saw Mill and Henry Hudson Parkways into midtown (about 20 minutes without traffic). Rooms are large (efficiency type with sink, microwave, etc.) clean, staff is friendly, full complementary breakfast is available with some deals. Restaurants are nearby. No need to fuss with metro NYC traffic or high parking mid town parking rates. Stay here, drive to the city limits, park on the street and take public transportation to your final destination. If you're looking for a less expensive way to stay in the greater NYC area and don't mind using public transportation, this may be an ideal alternative.
reviews.title: A Gem Tucked Away But Close To NYC

reviews.text: We live in NY and were without power for a week. Somehow we got a room. From the moment we checked in to the time we left, our stay was so nice. We had to move rooms a couple of times, but each room was clean and the hotel staff was exceptional. Eddie at the front desk helped us with anything we needed and made our week much better. He remembered us each morning and always asked if there was anything he could do for us. He seemed to be at the hotel around the clock because so many people had been displaced by Hurricane Sandy. Daniela at the breakfast buffet was also so nice. The whole staff was attentive and friendly. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean as well. The only thing missing were mints on the pillows.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: I would stay here again. Very convenient to my location. Very helpful staff. Rooms updated. Gym above average. Nice basketball court. Lots of parking. Applebee's restaurant down the hill. Gas station up the hill.
reviews.title: Decent stay

reviews.text: In the process of restoring an old house located five hours away from my current residence. This facility is my place of choice whenever I stay overnight; however, that depends on the pricing that particular day. Their rates have ranged from about $120/night to as high as $180. While I don't mind paying for a clean and well furnished room that also includes a nice breakfast selection, I don't believe in overpaying. Of course, if I was on vacation, that would be different.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and clean but a bit pricey for the location.

reviews.text: Located in a quiet and convenient location, most locals I know in the area don't even know it exists.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay!

reviews.text: This was our second stay at this hotel and we will not stay here again. The rate is always at least $40-50 per night more than the Hampton Inn across the street and there is no reason to stay at the Residence Inn unless you must have a kitchenete and can't get a studio suite at the Hampton. We did not find the hallways to be clean and the pool was an even bigger disappointment. There were no towels remaining (and this was not remedied even after I asked), the water was murky, and I found hairs wrapped around my fingers after each lap that I swam. We had a basic room, which was quite cramped and had a poor layout. The air conditioner did not have an adjustable fan speed and the vent blew directly at the bed. The bed was located in such a position that barely six inches existed between it and the window wall on one side. The furniture in the room was worn and in need of repair or replacement, even though the property is relatively new. We only stayed here because the Hampton Inn was unavailable on Saturday night, but we cancelled the second night of our stay, moved to the Hampton on Sunday morning, saved $45 on the room rate, and had a much nicer, larger room in a hotel of the same age that is still in pristine condition.
reviews.title: Distinctly Inferior to Hampton

reviews.text: Rooms are very comfortable and well laid out for an extended stay. You will have everything you need and just in case you don't the staff will go out of their way to make sure you get it. From check-in to check-out this hotel gets an A+ for customer service and comfort.
reviews.title: Comfort with great customer service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needed a place close to Yankee Stadium because we had a tour in the morning before we headed back to Boston. We lucked out and found this great place to stay. The customer service is amazing. Eddie at the front desk took care of everything we asked for. Even found us milk at 10:00 at night to go with some cookies we had. Their business center computer wouldn't print our tour tickets and he printed them for us. Monday through Thursday night they have a social hour with food. It was Mac and cheese. The breakfast is hot and good. My pillow was a bit lumpy because they wash them. We were in a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen. Great place to stay a few days as a jumping point for places you may not otherwise visit. It is close to Sleepy Hollow and Bronx attractions and was a nice place to take a break outside of the city.
reviews.title: Great customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Residence Inn has always been one of my favorite brands of the Marriott Chain. I love the fact that it is pet friendly, and the room is more than just 2 double beds.
reviews.title: Great Find !

reviews.text: Room was clean and fresh, staff was warm and friendly, breakfast was great. I really appreciated the gas firepit in the courtyard, very nice touch.
reviews.title: New and comfortable

reviews.text: We stayed here the weekend it opened about 4 years ago and twice after that. Our stay this time was 5 days. Rooms are comfortable and well laid out with complete kitchen. There is a nice breakfast offerred every morning. There is a small basketball court, simple exercise room, pool.
reviews.title: Simply a great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Everyone was very friendly and helpful- as should be in a hotel. And they tried to be as flexible as possible with our early check-in and somewhat late check-out.
reviews.title: Very nice especially if you want to eat some meals in.

reviews.text: What I especially liked is the free wifi, free use of business center, free printing, free faxing, free shuttle service to train station. They don't try to nickle and dime you for everything - oh yes, there are coin washing machines too.
reviews.title: Good option.

reviews.text: I switched over to Residence Inn for a longer business trip because I wanted to limit the meals I ate out at restaurants. I had been staying at Hampton Inn and Suites nearby but they did not have even a refrigerator in the room.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, ample parking, free breakfast

reviews.text: Residence inn is fairly new with lovely rooms. There is a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, two-burner stove and microwave. The sitting room is separate but open to the bed area.
reviews.title: Extended stay home away from home

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for an extended period of time starting in 2012 and ending in January 2013. I am a frequent traveler and found myself needing to be in Westchester county for a few months making this Residence Inn a logical choice.
reviews.title: Average for the most part

reviews.text: The room- I had several rooms through my stay as the first room I had was very nice, clean and comfortable . Unfortunately it did not have functioning A/C and eventually I was moved to a room on the first floor that was lacking a window and was quite dark. Furniture was a little more beat down and room felt more "used". It was decent enough just not nearly as nice as I would expect in a Marriott. The third and final room was also first floor, was better with a second window but still had seen better days. Furniture replacement would be good and more frequent carpet cleaning for sure. I encountered many centipedes and ants in my room also so maybe an exterminator is in order. Also there was a constant buzzing from some sort of mechanicals so maybe avoid first floor if this would be an issue for you.
reviews.title: Unreliable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shuttle- do not count on it being on time but it was nice enough. The available times are limited.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Front desk staff- This is the bright shining star of this hotel. The young men and one lady working the front desk are fantastic. Very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Awesome place

reviews.text: Housekeeping- Many housepeekers were sweet but a few were very intimidating. In fact I felt uncomfortable encountering several of them in the hallways. One red headed girl gave me the death glare regularly, not sure why or what the issue was as I always tipped whoever serviced my room. The main issue I had was many days they would skip servicing my room, there was not a do not disturb sign on the door or anything, I guess they just didn't feel like working that day. Ultimately I just always got the general impression me wanting my room serviced was asking too much of them. It shouldn't be like that and this was by far my least favorite part of this hotel.
reviews.title: Will definitely be back here
